text: Runze Li is an American statistical scientist, currently the Verne M. Willaman Professor of Statistics at Eberly College of Science, Pennsylvania State University. He became a Fellow of the American Statistical Association in 2011 and a Fellow of the American Association for the Advancement of Science in 2017. ==Education== He earned his Ph.D at University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill in 2000. ==Research== His highest cited paper is Variable selection via nonconcave penalized likelihood and its oracle propertiesJ Fan, R Li - Journal of the American statistical Association, 2001. Variable Selection via Nonconcave Penalized Likelihood and its Oracle Properties.
